abstract: Government Accountability Office rules Obama administration violated law when it used money collected through Affordable Care Act that was earmarked for Treasury to pay health insurance companies; Health and Human Services Dept disagrees with ruling, saying amount collected was less than expected, giving government discretion on how to spend it; administration used money to hold down insurance premiums by covering moderate increases.

headline.print_headline: Insurers Got Funds Meant for Treasury, Auditors Say
headline.main: U.S. Paid Insurers Funds Meant for Treasury, Auditors Say

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Federal auditors ruled that the Obama administration had violated the law by paying insurers more than allowed under the Affordable Care Act in an effort to hold down insurance premiums....
lead_paragraph: Federal auditors ruled that the Obama administration had violated the law by paying insurers more than allowed under the Affordable Care Act in an effort to hold down insurance premiums.
